images.caption: Fred Dibnah memorial. A lasting memorial for Fred in his home town but not everybody is convinced that it is a true likeness. The glass case behind contains a locally built preserved steam engine. Dibnah was an English steeplejack and television personality, starring in BBC documentaries.

description: This large town in Greater Manchester has a number of local parks, several nearby reservoirs and some riverside trails to try. This walk visits Queen's Park in the Gilnow area of the town. There's some nice footpaths here along the River Croal with flowerbeds, and a series of grade II listed statues on the central terrace, including one of former British prime minister Benjamin Disraeli. The park is located just to the north-west of Bolton town centre, near to the train station. To continue your walking in the town head north to visit Moss Bank Park and Smithills Country Park. Here you'll find miles of cycling and walking trails surrounding the 14th century Smithhills Hall. On the western edge of the town there's some peaceful woodland trails to be found at Doffcocker Lodge Nature Reserve.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Queen's Park is a nice place to take your dog for a walk as is the nearby Smithills and the woodland at Doffcocker Lodge mentioned above.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: There's an on site cafe at Queen's Park where you can enjoy refreshments in a pleasant setting. If you fancy a pub then The Greyhound is located just east of the park. The friendly pub can be found at 146 Deansgate with a postcode of BL1 1BB for your sat navs.
